omega="(s*t*a^2*omega_a)/((s*t+mb)*b^2)"
problem.p:
A drum of mass ma and radius a rotates freely with initial angular velocity \(\omega_a\) (type in as omega_a). A second drum with mass mb and radius b > a is mounted on the same axle and is at rest, although it is free to rotate. A thin layer of sand is distributed on the inner surface of the smaller drum. At t = 0, small perforations in the inner drum are opened. The sand starts to fly out at a constant rate s kg/s and sticks to the outer drum.
Find the subsequent angular velocity of drum \(\omega_b\) as a function of time. Ignore the transit time of the sand.
